intro: Outreya carduiformis, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its spiny, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting to its harsh environment. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a splash of color to the desert landscape. Outreya carduiformis is often found in sandy soils and rocky outcrops, thriving in full sun. Its unique morphology makes it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
